title: GOONYA FIGHTER - SWITCH LAUNCH TRAILER
body:
Walk too far and you flop over; punch the wrong way and be sent flying!

And get back up again just as easily!

For beginners and pros alike, welcome to a different kind of fighting game.

Via internet or local communication get into the squidgy world of Goonya Fighter.
Fight with other “Goonya Fighters” around the world.
Increase your ranks and winnings and get access to more characters.
One console, two Joy-Con, double the fun!
Internet battles can also be fought in teams, one team sharing one Joy-Con.
Take on the challenge with a sibling, a best friend, a family member, your lover, your dog.
There are only 4 buttons to use!
Punch with (A), Kick with (B), Jump with (X), Guard with (Y). That’s it!
Be warned though: you’ll still be getting into very heated matches.
3 game modes, 90 battlefields, one hell of a game!
The 3 game mode are as follows:
The “battle” mode.
The “coin pick-up” mode.
The “race” mode.
Each mode can be played with up to 4 people.
Master the various stages to beat your enemies
Kick bombs toward them; force them onto crumbling floors;
Utilise the surrounding magma and water and gorge on the resulting chaos!
Polish your technique in Story Mode
Enjoy solo play in story mode and become a strong fighter.
As Nyack, plunge into battle against the interfering Amoebas with your companion Mash.
Fend off the enemies and their numerous traps and be the best!

Using one console (two Joy-Con), you can team up and have even more fun in story mode!

summary: WHAT REMAINS OF EDITH FINCH RELEASING NEXT WEEK ON SWITCH ESHOP
title: WHAT REMAINS OF EDITH FINCH RELEASING NEXT WEEK ON SWITCH ESHOP
body:
What Remains of Edith Finch has been announced for a release on Nintendo Switch. The beloved game will be coming July 4 for 2200 yen. The adventure game will take 2.2GB!

An overview follows below…

What Remains of Edith Finch is a collection of strange tales about a family in Washington state.

As Edith, you’ll explore the colossal Finch house, searching for stories as she explores her family history and tries to figure out why she’s the last one in her family left alive. Each story you find lets you experience the life of a new family member on the day of their death, with stories ranging from the distant past to the present day.

The gameplay and tone of the stories are as varied as the Finches themselves. The only constants are that each is played from a first-person perspective and that each story ends with that family member’s death.

Ultimately, it’s a game about what it feels like to be humbled and astonished by the vast and unknowable world around us.

Created by Giant Sparrow, the team behind the first-person painting game The Unfinished Swan.

summary: Nintendo, Microsoft y Sony se unen en contra los nuevos impuestos de Trump
title: Nintendo, Microsoft y Sony se unen en contra los nuevos impuestos de Trump
excerpt: Microsoft, Nintendo of America y Sony Interactive Entertainment acaban de firmar un documento conjunto frente a la cámara de representantes de Estados Unidos para manifestar su descontento y dura desaprobación ante los impuestos y aranceles con los que quiere gravar el presidente Donald Trump a las exportaciones.
description: Microsoft, Nintendo of America y Sony Interactive Entertainment acaban de firmar un documento conjunto frente a la cámara de representantes de Estados Unidos para manifestar su descontento y dura desaprobación ante los impuestos y aranceles con los que quiere gravar el presidente Donald Trump a las exportaciones.

Wednesday Update：Yo-kai Watch 4 Scores 37/40 And Opens With 150k,  Plus Much More News！

Please support me by shopping here (use...
body:
Wednesday Update：Yo-kai Watch 4 Scores 37/40 And Opens With 150k, Plus Much More News！

Please support me by shopping here
(use JPNINTENDO for 5% off)!

Yokai Watch 4 received high praise in its Weekly Famitsu review, scoring 37/40 from its four reviewers, with one awarding it a 10. The critical success didn’t necessarily translate over to commercial success however as the entry debuted with a little over 150,000 units sold, a far cry from the almost 1.3 million of the second game…

View On WordPress

summary:
CONTRA Rogue Corps - Nintendo Switch | $39.99 Buy-Now!  
							CONTRA ROGUE CORPS is an over the top run and gun game with fast...
caption:
CONTRA Rogue Corps - Nintendo Switch | $39.99 Buy-Now!

  • CONTRA ROGUE CORPS is an over the top run and gun game with fast paced ultra-violent combat. Offering both single and multiplayer options, CONTRA ROGUE CORPS is an incredible gameplay experience, alone, or with your friends.
  • An action platformer with fast paced gameplay and Run & Gun style, with four available characters to select with diverse skills and specialty attacks.
  • Play Campaign Multiplayer online with friends, and enjoy unique PVP game modes.
  • In-game cut scenes and artwork produced by professional comic book artists and animators
  • From the Producer of Contra 3 and Director Contra Hard Corps.

title: my issues w BOTW
body:
• ~magical~ feeling is lacking : i love the ancient magitech of the sheikah and have no issue w its inclusion, regarding the more ~magical~ feel u get at the dragons/Mt Lanayru, Temple of Time, Korok Forest and Satori Mtn, i wanted more moments of mystery and wonder outside of those. like they couldve built on the horned statue, we could’ve had a simple “magic” feature instead of those delicate ass elemental rods
  • the enemies get old : ok so their color determines their strength lv..NEXT. its sad to see such a vast world populated by only 20ish species of monster. and like they’re all pretty boring after a while, the hinox is a big one eyed bokoblin, the moblin is a skinny dumblooking bokoblin, lynel are lowkey easiest enemy to fight, wizrobe keese and chuus are annoying, only the molduga i’d say is consistently engaging 
  • the rain is completely debilitating : i’d get if it made u climb slower, but to sLIP EVERY 2 SECONDS IS A BIT MUCH, it’s made rainy weather just so unenjoyable as a mechanic which is sad cuz its nice ambient music :/
  • human settlements are handled poorly : we have Kakariko village, Gerudo town, Kara Kara Bazaar, Hateno village, Lurelin village and thats it. particularly for the Hylians i wanted to see more of other people settling in the wilds instead of another identically looking fucking STABLE which brings me to!
  • let me register more animals than horses god damn it : there’s the “Crowned Beast” shrine quest where u have to ride a stag, BUT U CAN NEVER REGISTER ONE :( i wish they gave us larger deer/elk that we could register as steeds and live my wood elf dreams </3 same for other creatures u can ride , let me really immerse myself AND CAN I HAVE A CAMEL FOR THAT DAMN DESSERT 
    • ugh….and water-based steeds…..
  • Yiga Clan deserved their own hidden village : for an ages old cult for calamity ganon i would have loved to be able to in disguise walk around their own village, buy bananas and couldve been only place u could buy rare items “black market” style like the gerudo&radiant shields, the silverscale spear, yiga weapons

• ~magical~ feeling is lacking : i love the ancient magitech of the sheikah and have no issue w its inclusion, regarding the more ~magical~ feel u get at the dragons/Mt Lanayru, Temple of Time, Korok Forest and Satori Mtn, i wanted more moments of mystery and wonder outside of those. like they couldve built on the horned statue, we could’ve had a simple “magic” feature instead of those delicate ass elemental rods
  • the enemies get old : ok so their color determines their strength lv..NEXT. its sad to see such a vast world populated by only 20ish species of monster. and like they’re all pretty boring after a while, the hinox is a big one eyed bokoblin, the moblin is a skinny dumblooking bokoblin, lynel are lowkey easiest enemy to fight, wizrobe keese and chuus are annoying, only the molduga i’d say is consistently engaging 
  • the rain is completely debilitating : i’d get if it made u climb slower, but to sLIP EVERY 2 SECONDS IS A BIT MUCH, it’s made rainy weather just so unenjoyable as a mechanic which is sad cuz its nice ambient music :/
  • human settlements are handled poorly : we have Kakariko village, Gerudo town, Kara Kara Bazaar, Hateno village, Lurelin village and thats it. particularly for the Hylians i wanted to see more of other people settling in the wilds instead of another identically looking fucking STABLE which brings me to!
  • let me register more animals than horses god damn it : there’s the “Crowned Beast” shrine quest where u have to ride a stag, BUT U CAN NEVER REGISTER ONE :( i wish they gave us larger deer/elk that we could register as steeds and live my wood elf dreams </3 same for other creatures u can ride , let me really immerse myself AND CAN I HAVE A CAMEL FOR THAT DAMN DESSERT 
    • ugh….and water-based steeds…..
  • Yiga Clan deserved their own hidden village : for an ages old cult for calamity ganon i would have loved to be able to in disguise walk around their own village, buy bananas and couldve been only place u could buy rare items “black market” style like the gerudo&radiant shields, the silverscale spear, yiga weapons

summary: Nintendo Introduces Setes From Fire Emblem Three Houses
title: Nintendo Introduces Setes From Fire Emblem Three Houses
body:
Nintendo Introduces Setes From Fire Emblem Three Houses

A new character has been unveiled for the forthcoming Fire Emblem: Three Houses. The character is Setes and he works on behalf of the Archbishop of the Church of Seiros. As well as providing a short bio for the character, Nintendo has also produced a short video found in the tweet down below. Fire Emblem: Three Houses is due out 26th July on Nintendo Switch.

The aid to the Archbishop of the…

summary: The Japanese version of ‘Hatris’ on the NES features this unique title screen with artwork ‘Tetris’ creator Alexey Pajitnov. I...
caption: The Japanese version of ‘Hatris’ on the NES features this unique title screen with artwork ‘Tetris’ creator Alexey Pajitnov. I guess he just really likes hats. @tetris_official
